title: NEWS FLASH: Being in a duo doesnt mean you can steal peoples roles.
body: Im sorry, but it doesnt say anywhere that I have to give up adc because you are in a duo with a support. My last game ! refused to give adc to the mid laner and he still tried to steal adc from me. He locks in Draven but I still go bot. He then goes mid but spam pings the whole game and flames.  We ended up losing the game cause we had an all ad comp, and the duo tells the enemy team to report me for int feeding, when i was 4-8.

Doesn't matter if they report you or not.
The truth is that they stole the role and picked someone that can't fill theirs in order to force you to play something else and that loss is entirely their fault + disrupting the game. And all because they think being in a premade trumps everything else.
Just a reminder to those assholes cirklejerking the boards - Riot still punishes people.
#The unseen report is the deadliest.
http://imgur.com/oTjpBiY.png[/img]

Duo's can troll all they want.
Riot really doesn't punish trolling as hard as they punish people that are toxic.
So now all you really need to do is troll, keep a nice score and never type. LOL

All forms of toxicity is generally called "disrupting the game". Whether you decide to use the chat or do it through your actions alone, your days are numbered.

Chat offences are easier to identify and detecting certain behavior is a bit tougher. But both options get punished and that depends on the severity and frequency of the offences. Repeating offenders give Riot more and more information with each game that builds a report card against them. In certain cases, you may even choose to report a player directly to Riot Support in order to put them on Riot's radar, if you know what he has done has been against the strictest of rules but you know the action was probably going to be used rarely - and therefore go undetected for a time.

While what they did was very rude and stupid, you going bot after he locked draven probably screwed your team over and cost you the game. The best thing to do there is either dodge because you know they're going to be toxic, or take one for the team, let the duo go bot, and take mid.

Happy team mates are good team mates, so usually if someone asks me to swap roles with them, so long as it's a role I can play proficiently, I'll do it.
